title: The antidiabetic properties of lignans: a comprehensive review.
abstract: Diabetes mellitus (DM) is a chronic metabolic disease with a high global prevalence. Lignans, a class of plant natural compounds found in commonly consumed foods, are well-tolerated by humans and have demonstrated promising potential in the management of DM. Consumption of lignan-rich foods has been associated with improved overall health and quality of life.
journal: Phytomedicine : international journal of phytotherapy and phytopharmacology
